description: Number of partitions of 1/n into 3 reciprocals of positive integers.
comments: Number of ways to express 1/n as Egyptian fractions in just three terms; i.e., 1/n = 1/x + 1/y + 1/z satisfying 1<=x<=y<=z.See A073101 for the 4/n conjecture due to ErdÅ‘s and Straus.
links: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Index entries for sequences related to Egyptian fractions
mathematica: a[n_] := Length@ Solve[ 1/n == 1/x + 1/y + 1/z && 1 <= x <= y <= z, {x, y, z}, Integers]; Array[a, 70] (* _Allan C. Wechsler_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 17 2013 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=my(t=1/n, t1, s, c); for(a=1\t+1, 3\t, t1=t-1/a; for(b=max(1\t1+1, a), 2\t1, c=1/(t1-1/b); if(denominator(c)==1&&c>=b, s++))); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 12 2013
author: Scott Aaronson (philomath(AT)voicenet.com)
extensions: More terms from _David W. Wilson_, Aug 15 1996
